Termination Rights: Review the agreement for the conditions and procedures under which either party may terminate the contract. Specify notice periods, grounds for termination, and consequences of termination (e.g., forfeiture of deposit, reimbursement obligations, or penalties).
Dispute Resolution: Identify the mechanism for resolving disputes between the parties. Note whether the agreement requires arbitration, litigation, or another process, including the governing law and venue/jurisdiction for resolution.
Assignment or Transfer Restrictions: Examine the contract for any clauses restricting or permitting assignment, transfer, or delegation of rights and obligations to third parties. Specify any requirements for written consent and whether such consent may be unreasonably withheld.
